venice.hub

Class VeniceHub

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.hub.VeniceHub

  • public class VeniceHub
extends java.lang.Object
    Starts and stops all other threads.
    Author:
    Jens Eickmeyer, Oliver Eickmeyer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long CHECK_IF_STOPPED_WHILE_PAUSED_INTERVAL
      Threads (especially subclasses of VeniceReader and VeniceWriter) should check if they were commanded to stop while they were paused.
      static long INVALID_TIMESTAMP
      Defines a unique value for marking timestamps as invalid.

    • Field Detail

      • INVALID_TIMESTAMP

        public static final long INVALID_TIMESTAMP
        Defines a unique value for marking timestamps as invalid. Usually this value is got from venice.lib (venice.lib.parser.XIOParser.INVALID_TIMESTAMP).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHECK_IF_STOPPED_WHILE_PAUSED_INTERVAL

        public static final long CHECK_IF_STOPPED_WHILE_PAUSED_INTERVAL
        Threads (especially subclasses of VeniceReader and VeniceWriter) should check if they were commanded to stop while they were paused. This defines the interval for such checks (in ms).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method. Creates VeniceHub, which organize all other threads.
        Parameters:
        args - optional command line arguments, first argument is treated as a path to a configuration file

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(java.lang.String[] args)
        Initializes all variables, does some basic setup and starts all threads (the reader, the writer and all controllers). This is the first method that gets called, when VeniceHub is started.
        Parameters:
        args - This are the command line arguments. There is only one possible argument, the name of a configuration file (optional).

      • switchPause

        public static void switchPause()
        Switches between pause and play.

      • setPause

        public static void setPause(boolean p)
        Sets pause or play mode.
        Parameters:
        p - true will pause, false will un-pause

      • seekForRelativePosition

        public static void seekForRelativePosition(long relativeTimestamp)
        Seek for a timestamp relative to the timestamp of the first line in the file being replayed. This can also be modified by an optional offset.

        The relative timestamp will be changed into an absolute timestamp and than the seekForTimestamp method is called.

        Parameters:
        relativeTimestamp -

      • seekForTimestamp

        public static void seekForTimestamp(long seekTime)
        Seek for a absolute timestamp (a timestamp in the log file, without any modifications).
        Parameters:
        seekTime - Timestamp to seek.

      • quit

        public static void quit()
        Commands all threads to stop, waits until all threads are finished and will then stop the virtual machine.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Resets the reader (will start from the beginning again), so reading from file will restart from beginning. This includes clearing the queue and unpausing (if paused).

      • showBuffer

        public static void showBuffer()
        Shows some information about the disk-reader buffer.

      • showLastWrittenTS

        public static void showLastWrittenTS()
        Shows the timestamp of the last written event

      • showTSOfFirstLine

        public static void showTSOfFirstLine()
        Shows the timestamp of the first line of the file. Only useful if reading from file.

      • saveLagHistory

        public static void saveLagHistory()
        Saves lag history to file, if enabled.

      • switchMsg

        public static void switchMsg()
        Switches between message mode on/off.

      • message

        public static void message(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a message to the default output.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be send

      • message

        public static void message(java.lang.String msg,
           boolean linefeed)
        Sends a message to the default output.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be send
        linefeed - if a linefeed should be added

      • giveNiceTimeString

        public static java.lang.String giveNiceTimeString(long t)
        Converts a Timestamp into a more readable String.
        Parameters:
        t - Timestamp (in milliseconds)
        Returns:
        String representing the Timestamp t

      • addReplayDelay

        public static void addReplayDelay(long delay)
        Adds a value (ms) to the replay delay by which timestamps of events are modified before they are replayed. See setReplayDelay for more information.
        Parameters:
        delay - milliseconds to add to the delay

      • setReplayDelay

        public static void setReplayDelay(long delay)
        Sets the replay delay by which timestamps of events are modified before they are replayed. This relates only to events from XIO lines from a replay file. This delay is defined by the starting time of the replay and by any pauses made during replay.

        When starting the replay, the delay will be the difference between the timestamp of the first line and the actual system time, so the replay starts immediately. The duration of every pause will be added to that delay.

        Parameters:
        delay - delay (ms) by which events are delayed when replaying

      • getReplayDelay

        public static long getReplayDelay()
        Gets the replay delay by which timestamps of events are modified before they are replayed. See setReplayDelay for more information.
        Returns:
        delay (ms) by which events are delayed when replaying

      • getReplayOffset

        public static long getReplayOffset()
        Gets the offset by which timestamps of events are modified before they are replayed. This relates only of events from XIO lines from a replay file.

        The offset can be used by the user or an external application to synchronize replays.

        Returns:
        offset (ms) to modify timestamp before replaying the event

      • setReplayOffset

        public static void setReplayOffset(long offset)
        Sets the timestamp-offset for replaying files. The timestamp of the events parsed from XIO lines of the replay file are getting modified by the offset before they get into the queue. *

        The offset can be used by the user or an external application to synchronize replays.

        Parameters:
        offset - offset (ms) to modify timestamp before replaying the event

      • getShiftedTimestampOf1stLine

        public static long getShiftedTimestampOf1stLine()
        Returns:
        Returns the timestamp of the first line plus replay start offset

      • getTimestampOf1stLine

        public static long getTimestampOf1stLine()
        Gets the timestamp of the first XIO line in the replay file (for disk source mode).
        Returns:
        timestamp of first XIO line in replay file

      • setTimestampOf1stLine

        public static void setTimestampOf1stLine(long timestamp)
        Sets the timestamp of the first XIO line in the replay file (for disk source mode).
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp of first XIO line in replay file

      • getLastPushedTimestamp

        public static long getLastPushedTimestamp()

        Returns:
        timestamp of the last pushed event

      • setLastPushedTimestamp

        public static void setLastPushedTimestamp(long timestamp)
        Sets the timestamp of the last pushed event (for network writer modes).
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp of the last pushed event

      • setMessageEnabled

        public static void setMessageEnabled(boolean state)
        Should messages for the console be enabled?
        Parameters:
        state - True or False

      • getMessageEnabled

        public static boolean getMessageEnabled()
        Returns true if messages are enabled, or false if not.
        Returns:
        true if messages are enabled; false otherwise

      • getTimestampOfLastLine

        public static long getTimestampOfLastLine()
        Returns the timestamp of the last line in the replay file. This is only for disk source. The timestamp will be INVALID_TIMESTAMP, if the timestamp of the last line is unknown.
        Returns:
        timestamp of last line in replay file

      • setTimestampOfLastLine

        public static void setTimestampOfLastLine(long newTimestampOfLastLine)
        Sets the timestamp of the last line in the file. This is only for disk source.
        Parameters:
        newTimestampOfLastLine - timestamp of last line in replay file

      • getPreferredXIOParser

        public static venice.lib.parser.XIOParser getPreferredXIOParser()
        Returns the xioParser used for parsing XIO lines.
        Returns:
        xioParser used for parsing XIO lines

      • setPreferredXIOParser

        public static void setPreferredXIOParser(venice.lib.parser.XIOParser p)
        Sets the xioParser to be used for parsing XIO lines.
        Parameters:
        p - the xioParser to be used for parsing

      • setLagHistoryEnabled

        public static void setLagHistoryEnabled(boolean state)
        Enables or disables the lag history.
        Parameters:
        state - true if lag history should be enabled; false otherwise

      • isLagHistoryEnabled

        public static boolean isLagHistoryEnabled()
        Returns true if the lag history is enabled, or false if not.
        Returns:
        true if the lag history is enabled; false otherwise

      • setLagLogN

        public static void setLagLogN(int n)
        Sets the rhythm of logging lag data. A value of 1 means that for every item lag data will be collected. For large files it could be better to increase the value (for example for a file with a density of 2 megabytes per second a value of 200).
        Parameters:
        n - Every n'th data item will be measured

      • getLagLogN

        public static int getLagLogN()
        See setLagLogN.
        Returns:
        The setting of how dense the lag measuring will be

      • getLastActivity

        public static long getLastActivity()
        Gives the system time of last activity in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        system time of last activity (ms)

      • updateLastActivity

        public static void updateLastActivity()
        Update last activity timer.
        This sets the last activity timer to the current system time (ms).
